g.g: luxury is relative

Luxury is relative. A same Luxury to one person may be different to another. Luxury can be an experience in a hotel's French restaurant. It can also be spending precious time with your family. Simply said, we all have our own kind of Luxury!
Mrs and Mr. Sudani
We have decided to come to the hotel for our 20 years anniversary celebration. We booked a room, a diner and a SPA. It's really amazing. We enjoy every moment of our stay. It's like a dream.
Brad Pitt

I love to come to this hotel with my children, without telling anyone. I don't want any special VIP welcoming, or any special SPA offered to us. I just appreciate the peace the hotel is able to give us. We don't even go to the restaurant of the hotel, but instead, ask the concierge to get some street food for us! This is to me, the true Luxury.
Michelle Thomson

My Luxury is to try the best SPA of the best hotels. It's a lot of money to me, but I really enjoy the experience. I cannot afford once a week, or even once a month because this is an exceptional visit, and that's why is a real Luxury to me.
Alexander Paulson

My Luxury is to arrive at the hotel and have my room key ready without check-in. To me, the true Luxury is the service I received every time I arrived. I will have dinner at the restaurant of the hotel and just get a good sleep after. I love the Mandarin Oriental hotel.
luxury is always emotional

Luxury is not necessarily functional. The beauty of the Luxury is in the emotion it gives to us. Luxury creations, by its design and quality, are able to generate positive emotions. Do you need a watch to know the time? Is an alligator-skin handbag preferred because it's more durable? Would you buy a Ferrari for the possibility to drive at super speed?
Ferrari
Hermes
Piaget
francis SRUN
Luxury is not simply functional; it is necessarily emotional.
luxury is always exceptional
Because it's exceptional, Luxury gives us emotion and pleasure.
Oscar Wilde
Let me be surrounded by luxury, I can do without the necessities!
3 key characteristics of luxury
Luxury always has 3 common points: Identity (DNA), Know-How and Quality.
There is no Luxury without quality. it's the quality of the materials used, the quality of the design, the quality of the crafting, and the quality of the distribution.

There is no Luxury without know-how. It could be a secular crafting art performed by artisans. It's often a creative design which makes the differences. The know-how also resides in the communication with clients and clientele service.

There is no Luxury without Brands. The Brand is often a name, with a success story. It has, very often an impressive heritage. All these elements make the personality of the brand. A brand has its own territory, imaginary. That's why a Luxury brand is always Exceptional.
3 different luxury
There are principally 3 categories of Luxury: Ultra Luxury, Luxury and Affordable Luxury. Click to flip the cards below:

Affordable luxury concerns brands and products which are at a reasonable price point. These brands have good notoriety and offer very good quality and design products. The products take the codes of the luxury with a lower price point. Sandro and Longines are good examples.

source.g: Affordable Luxury

g.g: Luxury concerns brands, products which are at a very high price level. The brands have heritage or very strong public recognition. The brands propose very high-quality products with a strong design. Dior and Omega are good examples.

source.g: Luxury

g.g: Ultra-luxury or prestige luxury concerns brands, products which are at the highest level of their categories. There are only a few brands which are able to be at the highest level. Ultra-luxury brand is exceptional in its heritage, savoir-faire, utilize rare and precious materials to achieve the exceptional quality. Chanel and Patek Philippe are good examples.

g.g: show luxury
In the previous section, we talked about having a Luxury appearance. Now, let's understand how you should show it to the clients.

Successful sales advisors are able to establish true and long-lasting relationships with their clients. Moreover, they are able to set-up, very quickly if not immediately, a qualitative client relationship. They are necessarily outgoing, open, pleasant and charming. Going further than breaking the ice, the best advisors know how to « attract » (aspire) the client to them.

Now it’s about gestures, your body language. The way you move in the store and how you sit tells a lot about you. Your hands are important too, nicely controlled gestures become part of your expression and will help your communication with clients.
Be aware of your movements. Be graceful and handle physical contacts with care.
As you see in the previous chapter, here you become a luxury, a high-value product with a sophisticated image you want to project. It shall be the same as the way you communicate. U
se a gentle tone and bear in mind, a conversation is not a monologue!

As said before, your appearance is the first message you give to your visitor, and as the French say, <<la première impression est souvent la bonne>> (meaning, the first impression is often the right one). It is crucial to be perceived positively and to avoid a bad image, which is nearly impossible to recover. So, make a good first impression.

But only looking good is insufficient. You are selling high-value items. Clients are expecting the best from you and your brand. You would want to build exceptional relations with clients as they are expecting a real experience.
Speak naturally and gently; avoid speaking too fast, too loud, or too complicated.
Now you know what Luxury is, but how to speak in a Luxury way?
Speak loudly with full of confidence
Speak with sophisticated vocabulary
Speak clearly at a comfortable pace
Speak like how rich people do

source.g: GOLDEN RULE
Upgrade the Yes and No: practice the No-Yes and No-No.
A simple upgrade is to never use Yes and No:

g.g: Yes -> wonderful, absolutely, certainly, or great.

what other ways to show luxury
ANY OTHER WAYS TO PRESENT YOURSELF?
You know about Luxury look, Luxury speaking, Luxury gestures and Luxury interactions. So, any other ways to show your professionalism as Sales Advisors?

Let’s keep on and imagine the best possible friend. It’s a person you can trust, a person who tells you the truth. A sincere person gives you the most precious gift: a true heart. It’s also a friend who is able to understand you as yourself. Last but not least, it’s someone who really cares about your feelings.

Like a real friend who respects you, helps you and even protects you. Better - if he is someone who never hesitates to offer you gifts. These gifts might not matter in terms of value but the way your friend had thought about them, and the way he delivered the gifts to you, really counts!
A kind person is someone who can't harm you. Providing services is not sufficient: service is expected and Luxury selling invites you to go beyond.

The primordial gentle gesture is to respect, to give full respect to your client. It means that when your client comes into your boutique or showroom for luxury cars, be sure to leave the necessary space and time. These gestures of respect are what your client will expect from the best Maisons.

source.g: P.D. JAMES

Charm is often despised but I can never see why. No one has it who isn't capable of genuinely liking others, at least at the actual moment of meeting and speaking. Charm is always genuine: it may be superficial but it isn't false.

The first condition of charm is self-confidence. It allows the sales advisor to reassure the client and create a relaxed atmosphere. No one wants to deal with people who have poor self-esteem and doubt themselves. Plus, let us not forget that the advisor is also perceived, by some clients, as a simple intermediary between him and the desired product. It is thus a question of promoting access to products as pleasantly as possible.

Here I mean charm to the extent that it is outward-looking. Charm that emerges from a person and makes others want to go to him or her. It’s a capacity for attraction, disinterested, generous, full of finesse and delicate. In luxury the advisor has to sell himself, as much as he sells the brand and the product. In a way, the advisor embodies the brand for which he works.

Your sincere smile and willingness to help the customer are also vectors of attraction. It is not about trying to seduce or impress with your charm, charisma, clothes or even body language. It is a matter of doing everything possible to build customer confidence, to establish this human relationship. Generosity has to be omnipresent. We only charm if we are able to please others.

g.g: You can't sell without communicating with your client. A good communication improves your chances of closing and a lont term relation with your client. Here are three tips to master your communication.

source.g: Your tone must thus be kept at all-times gentle. To sell luxury creations and high value products, you need first of all to reassure.You need to turn your tone into the “gentle mode”. It means a smiling tone. Customers need to feel your smile in your voice. Gentle also means simple. You need to speak slowly and clearly.

Don’t use complicated words or mysterious abbreviations and absolutely avoid using foreign words in general. It is not necessary to show your expertise by scaring off your client. Your communication has to be simple,
Many of your clients will not be English native. Even if they speak English, it does not mean that they are able to understand everything. Especially if your tone is too quick or unclear.

g.g: With the right words in the appropriate Luxury tone, accompany it with the right gestures to emphasize your point. We often communicate through non-verbal actions: gesturing with your hands or pointing with your fingers. It is, therefore, important to have control over them.

Let's take an example, a simple "I LOVE YOU": according to the tone, can form a different kind of meanings. What forms your meaning is the tone you use. A Luxury Tone is a natural, soft and gentle one. But it is never superficial, artificial, or even worse: fake.
Using the right word is important: It says precisely about something. Remember, you cannot take back what you said. So, be sure to choose the right one.
A watch is named a Timepiece, or a time-keeper. A jewellery is nicely referred to as a jewellery creation.
You can also enrich your vocabulary. Luxury Selling means that your vocabulary should be rich, elegant and inspiring.

g.g: Know your clients

It’s obvious when you walk down Paris’s Rue Saint Honoré, London’s Bond Street or New York’s 5th Avenue, where the new luxury clientele is young and mainly Asian. But not only. Also diversified. In this changing world, need to know your clients.

source.g: They buy for themselves, but also donate and contribute in various manners. Luxury brands can in this way play a great role. They believe in values.
New generation is also used to a very fast world, where things are instantly available. They definitely do not accept delays or any kind of waiting. They have a "now only" way of life.

They also come from what is commonly called “new money”. They are e-business entrepreneurs, executives in AI, or from the world of finance. They have a money only relationship with money. It can come and go, but as long as it gives them meaning, they are happy. They have a very straightforward approach.

This new generation has a brand only approach. Indeed, they eat, wear, use and live brands. They do not have a single product without a brand. They like to talk about them, their stories but also their products. Their brands define who they are.

g.g: KNOW YIOUR CLIENTS AND APPRECIATE
luxury client's aspirations
Clients are certainly all different. What important to understand is that the need for self-affirmation is fundamental.
In here, let's see a few characteristics of Luxury clients.
François-Henri Pinault (Kering Group Owner)
Luxury corresponds to a human's aspiration - the need for self-affirmation
self-affirmation
Self-affirmation is the recognition and assertion of the value of one's individual self. Self-affirmation is translated into the following aspects:

We feel good when being recognized socially, by pairs. Celebrities give off self-confidence due to the perception on them, and this is another sign of success. Luxury products and creations contribute to the social recognition of Luxury clients.
As humans, we yearn for success, and we celebrate our successes, which are always rewarded. To most clients, Luxury creations or services help to express and represent their successes.
We all need self-esteem. Self-esteem gives us self-confidence and reduces fear. Luxury creations or services help clients to increase their self-esteem.
what if luxury is not only about the product?
Luxury isn't just about the product. It is also about pleasure. People who invest in Luxury items believe that life is not simply about sustenance.

Luxury clients' motto is often: "I love to learn new things." They know that learning new things is not only a necessity but also an immense pleasure. They appreciate the information on what they are buying. That's part of the pleasure of Luxury.

Luxury clients' motto is often: "What I really care is people". They appreciate the relationship with a Sales Advisor who they can trust. They treasure the high level of service, the outstanding relationships that Luxury creations or services give them.

Luxury clients' motto is often: "Why not if I really want it?" They have the ability and the power to buy and consume regardless of the price. This power gives the pleasure of being free in their choices and lifestyles.
Luxury clients' motto is often: "The best and nothing else". They can afford it. So, why would they go for lower quality when they can afford the best?
"the search for pleasure is part of human nature. luxury is about pleasures..."
